Player History
Signed as a free agent by Los Angeles on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 6/2/1985 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Traded from Los Angeles to Chicago on 7/24/1985 (Going to LAD: P Rick Sutcliffe. Going to CHC: P Juan Guzman, P Darren Holmes, LF Devon White, SS Jose Vizcaino)...
Injured on 4/20/1987 with a Jammed Finger, out for one week...
Earned first career win on 4/6/1988...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/20/1988, off Kevin J. Brown (ATL)...
Injured on 6/1/1988 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Injured on 3/18/1989 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,578,571 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $4,164,286 through salary arbitration...
Hit first career homerun on 4/18/1991, off Kevin Wickander (STL)...
Injured on 5/10/1991 with a Broken Finger, out for 3 weeks...
2/2/1992: Gets a new one-year contract worth $4,164,286 through salary arbitration...
6/1/1992: Signed a contract extension with Chicago, $4,700,000 per year, for 5 years.
Was selected to the 1992 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Chicago in 1992...
